ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all my first post. Abashi started that post himself asking for OUR opinions.  I can t bring myself to blame him for not knowing the Clouding wouldn t
ygData.messageBody:
Hello all my first post.
Abashi started that post himself asking for "OUR"
opinions. I can't bring myself to blame him for
not knowing the Clouding wouldn't twist, really.
I think what is most important is that HE asked
for OUR opinion. The first few posts I read were civil.
I really think we should remember He was asking "US".
Teien Truescale (Raging Boars)
22 Bard Prexus
-----Original Message-----
From: sentto-160851-19164-959862701-dbe=nwark.com@...
[mailto:sentto-160851-19164-959862701-dbe=nwark.com@...]
On Behalf Of Gordon Hughes
Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 5:40 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel


Lyrnia,

I don't doubt that he's a nice guy and knows his own class inside out and I
have a lot of respect for him for putting up with the flak from disgruntled
players daily.

However, I'm with Galtin on this one. Before tossing some ideas into the
lion's den, he should have checked with the spell gurus or at least someone
in-house that plays a Bard. It sounds like he even spoke with GZ about it.

If he did check, it's safe to assume the spell guys don't know how some Bard
songs interact with each other and/or they don't have a Bard of sufficient
level in-house to verify that twisting Invis with anything else doesn't
work.

-KS
